ygData.subject: Re: balancing EQ with real life :)
ygData.msgSnippet: The way my husband and I balance our EQ life and real life is that well.. we both have a characters on EQ and have had for over a year but we made a pact that
ygData.messageBody:
The way my husband and I balance our EQ life and real life is that well.. we
both have a characters on EQ and have had for over a year but we made a pact
that we play together so our characters are close to the same level. We
both like roleplaying and gaming so it helps. However, we too spent too
much time on EQ and took a break for several months and became involved in
other things. We then went back to it later and had even more fun. We also
limit ourselves if we get to involved in it. I think that EQ is very
addicting and it can ruin a relationship if someone is always on-line and
the other person has no interest in it at all. You have to balance your time
together and sometimes it means spending time doing things you may not
normally do. You might create a character to play with him on-line and in
return he spends time doing a hobby you like, or just going to dinner,
movie, etc. EQ is NOT the real world, and taking off from work to play is a
bit scary... but I can see how it can happen. I hope you can find a
balance, it is difficult.

Kat

----- Original Message -----
From: "Jennifer McNitt" <jenmcnitt@...>
To: <EQ_women@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, February 23, 2000 11:39 AM
Subject: [EQ_women] balancing EQ with real life :)


> From: Jennifer McNitt <jenmcnitt@...>
>
> I was just wondering how you all balance playing EQ with real life
> roles/duties.
>
> I'm not actually a EQ player myself, but my husband is. Since he started
to
> play EQ (over 6 months ago), we haven't done as much as we used to
together.
> Before EQ he played Ultima Online but was able to log whenever he felt
like
> it in that game.
>
> With EQ it seems like he has to be on longer to get anywhere in the game
and
> he isn't able to log whenever he wants to. He is a level 50 ranger and is
> in the Plain of Fear a lot right now. Due to the spawn rates he has to
stay
> up late, and be online every day. He even has taken off work periodically
> to be in the game more.
>
> I know a lot of the game just because it is mostly all of what we talk
about
> right now. :)
>
> I understand online role playing as I ran my own computer BBS for over 5
> years. I was an avid MUD/MUSH player myself for a while and did play
Ultima
> Online for a bit too. My husband and I actually meet on my BBS when I
was
> on college dated for about 3 years and have been married 3 1/2 years. We
> are both avid computer game players. Due to life/new hobbies/etc. I
haven't
> been in online games myself for the past 3 years.
>
> I really don't mind him playing EQ as I know it is what he likes to do.
We
> have an understanding that I let him play EQ and I spend my free time
doing
> SCA (medieval re-inactment group) activities.
>
> For Christmas all he wanted was anything EQ related. He also tells me if
I
> want to spend more time with him, that I should get a EQ account myself
(we
> have a home network which would make this possible). :)
>
> I was just wondering how others balance their life with their significant
> others and EQ playing.
>
> Thanks!
>
> Jen
>
>
>
>
>
